- **Claudia De La Cruz** (Peace and Freedom Party)
## McCloud Community Services District Board At-large
## California Proposition 2, Public Education Facilities Bond Measure (2024)
“Authorizes bonds for public school and community college facilities. Legislative statute.[5]”
## California Proposition 3, Right to Marry and Repeal Proposition 8 Amendment (2024)
“Constitutional right to marriage. Legislative constitutional amendment.[6]”
## California Proposition 33, Prohibit State Limitations on Local Rent Control Initiative (2024)
“Expands local governments' authority to enact rent control on residential property. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 34, Require Certain Participants in Medi-Cal Rx Program to Spend 98% of Revenues on Patient Care Initiative (2024)
“Restricts spending by health care providers meeting specified criteria. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 35, Managed Care Organization Tax Authorization Initiative (2024)
“Provides permanent funding for Medi-Cal Health Care Services. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 36, Drug and Theft Crime Penalties and Treatment-Mandated Felonies Initiative (2024)
“Allows felony charges and increases sentences for certain drug and theft crimes. Initiative statute.[10]”
## California Proposition 4, Parks, Environment, Energy, and Water Bond Measure (2024)
“Authorizes bonds for safe drinking water, wildfire prevention, and protecting communities and natural lands from climate risks. Legislative statute.[5]”
## California Proposition 5, Lower Supermajority Requirement to 55% for Local Bond Measures to Fund Housing and Public Infrastructure Amendment (2024)
“Allows local bonds for affordable housing and public infrastructure with 55% voter approval. Legislative constitutional amendment.[6]”
## California Proposition 6, Remove Involuntary Servitude as Punishment for Crime Amendment (2024)
“Eliminates constitutional provision allowing involuntary servitude for incarcerated persons. Legislative constitutional amendment.[5]”
## Mount Shasta, California, Measure B, Police and Fire Services Sale Tax Measure (November 2024)

“MEASURE BShall an ordinance be adopted authorizing the City of Mount Shasta to collect a sales tax (Transaction and Use Tax) of 1% to be used for Police and Fire Protection and to remain in effect until repealed or amended by the electorate and which will raise approximately $1,600,000 annually?YES_________ NO__________”
## Siskiyou County, California, Measure W, Appointed Auditor-Controller Measure (November 2024)

“MEASURE WShall the current voter elected position of County Auditor-Controller become a Siskiyou County Board of Supervisors' appointed position of Auditor-Controller with an effective date of January 4, 2027?YES_________ NO__________”
## Siskiyou Union High School District, California, Measure Z, School Improvements Bond Measure (November 2024)

“MEASURE ZWith funds that cannot be taken by the State and spent elsewhere, shall Siskiyou Union High School District’s measure to replace leaky roofs; update classrooms for Career Technical Education programs; and renovate Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEAM) facilities at Happy Camp High, McCloud High, Mount Shasta High and Weed High be adopted, authorizing $22 million of bonds with legal rates, audits, average levies below $29 per $100,000 of assessed valuation (raising $1.3 million annually) while outstanding, citizen oversight, and full public disclosure of spending?Bonds - Yes Bonds– No”
## South Yreka Fire Protection District, California, Measure T, Spending Limit Measure (November 2024)

“MEASURE TShall the South Yreka Fire Protection District be allowed to increase the spending limit pursuant to Article 13B of the California Constitution to an amount not to exceed Ninety Thousand Dollars ($90,000) per year for a period from the last election to set a spending limit for the period not to exceed the next four years?YES_________ NO__________”

column1: - **Claudia De La Cruz** (Peace and Freedom Party)
## McCloud Community Services District Board At-large
## California Proposition 2, Public Education Facilities Bond Measure (2024)
“Authorizes bonds for public school and community college facilities. Legislative statute.[5]”
## California Proposition 3, Right to Marry and Repeal Proposition 8 Amendment (2024)
“Constitutional right to marriage. Legislative constitutional amendment.[6]”
## California Proposition 33, Prohibit State Limitations on Local Rent Control Initiative (2024)
“Expands local governments' authority to enact rent control on residential property. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 34, Require Certain Participants in Medi-Cal Rx Program to Spend 98% of Revenues on Patient Care Initiative (2024)
“Restricts spending by health care providers meeting specified criteria. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 35, Managed Care Organization Tax Authorization Initiative (2024)
“Provides permanent funding for Medi-Cal Health Care Services. Initiative statute.[7]”
## California Proposition 36, Drug and Theft Crime Penalties and Treatment-Mandated Felonies Initiative (2024)
“Allows felony charges and increases sentences for certain drug and theft crimes. Initiative statute.[10]”
## California Proposition 4, Parks, Environment, Energy, and Water Bond Measure (2024)
“Authorizes bonds for safe drinking water, wildfire prevention, and protecting communities and natural lands from climate risks. Legislative statute.[5]”
## California Proposition 5, Lower Supermajority Requirement to 55% for Local Bond Measures to Fund Housing and Public Infrastructure Amendment (2024)
“Allows local bonds for affordable housing and public infrastructure with 55% voter approval. Legislative constitutional amendment.[6]”
## California Proposition 6, Remove Involuntary Servitude as Punishment for Crime Amendment (2024)
“Eliminates constitutional provision allowing involuntary servitude for incarcerated persons. Legislative constitutional amendment.[5]”
## Mount Shasta, California, Measure B, Police and Fire Services Sale Tax Measure (November 2024)

“MEASURE BShall an ordinance be adopted authorizing the City of Mount Shasta to collect a sales tax (Transaction and Use Tax) of 1% to be used for Police and Fire Protection and to remain in effect until repealed or amended by the electorate and which will raise approximately $1,600,000 annually?YES_________ NO__________”
## Siskiyou County, California, Measure W, Appointed Auditor-Controller Measure (November 2024)

“MEASURE WShall the current voter elected position of County Auditor-Controller become a Siskiyou County Board of Supervisors' appointed position of Auditor-Controller with an effective date of January 4, 2027?YES_________ NO__________”
## Siskiyou Union High School District, California, Measure Z, School Improvements Bond Measure (November 2024)

“MEASURE ZWith funds that cannot be taken by the State and spent elsewhere, shall Siskiyou Union High School District’s measure to replace leaky roofs; update classrooms for Career Technical Education programs; and renovate Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEAM) facilities at Happy Camp High, McCloud High, Mount Shasta High and Weed High be adopted, authorizing $22 million of bonds with legal rates, audits, average levies below $29 per $100,000 of assessed valuation (raising $1.3 million annually) while outstanding, citizen oversight, and full public disclosure of spending?Bonds - Yes Bonds– No”
## South Yreka Fire Protection District, California, Measure T, Spending Limit Measure (November 2024)

“MEASURE TShall the South Yreka Fire Protection District be allowed to increase the spending limit pursuant to Article 13B of the California Constitution to an amount not to exceed Ninety Thousand Dollars ($90,000) per year for a period from the last election to set a spending limit for the period not to exceed the next four years?YES_________ NO__________”
